title: About this blog
text:
This blog is a space for reflecting on my academic journey as an undergraduate psychology student at the University of Waterloo.
I plan to write about topics related to memory, cognition, and research methods, as well as my experiences conducting an Honours Thesis. Compared to my academic website, this space allows for more informal and exploratory thinking.
You can also find me on LinkedIn.

title: Why I’m Starting This Blog
text:
I’m starting this blog as a way to think more openly about psychology and research outside the constraints of formal academic writing.
As a student interested in memory and cognition, I often have questions and observations that don’t fit neatly into coursework or lab reports. This blog gives me a space to explore those ideas while also developing a professional online presence.

title: Samridhi Singh
text: Undergraduate student at the University of Waterloo.

title: Samridhi Singh
text:
Research Interests
For my thesis, I am studying how individuals remember and use language, exploring whether embedding meaningful information, like personal experiences or familiar characteristics, improves memory retention. This led me to the research question for my Honours Thesis:
How do visual proximity and semantic context influence adults’ ability to identify newly learned objects?
